headline: Kenvue Stock Hits All-Time Low, Turns Higher After-Hours
summary: Shares of consumer healthcare firm Kevnue dropped to a record low during regular trading Monday, then made up some ground afterhours as President Trump warned that acetaminophen, the active ingredient in Kenvue's Tylenol, is a potential cause of autism.  Kenvue shares were down 7.5% Monday, putting them down about 23% since the company's IPO shortly before its subsequent spinoff from Johnson & Johnson in mid-2023.  Kenvue stock hit a record low and was the worst performer in the S&P 500 Monday.

headline: Tylenol-maker Kenvue’s stock has lost a quarter of its value in 6 months as momentum grows for autism link despite repeated denials
summary: Kenvue rebuked claims of a connection between autism and acetaminophen and said it is “deeply concerned with the health risk this poses for expecting mothers.”
